column4: Been installing so many linux distros on my desktop now only to find that my problem exists on all of them..
The internet connetion si dead slow, resulting in endless errors when updating or installing anything that involves an internet connection
The internet connection works perfectly fine in Windows on the same computer..
Wired.. The computer is conneted to a 802.11n WLAN router through wire..
802.11n or g og b is irrelevant since im connected with a cable..
but yeah.. the router is connected directly to a laptop which shares its wireless internet connection
and as mentioned, it works perfectly fine in Windows without problems..
working with windows has no relevance to ubuntu other than proving the hardware is working
what wirless network card is in your laptop/machine
check with lspci see what ubuntu recognises it as
ok, so your laptop is acting as a proxy/router
and your desktop is not able to connect, correct ?
ok, so what network card is in your desktop ?
if you do an "ifconfig -a" how many "ethX" devices do you see ?
on the desktop do an "lspci" and see what ubuntu identifies your networks as
if you're not using ubuntu - we can't help you
